column2: TENNESSEE DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: TN

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 2. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column6: Construction and maintenance warning.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: School crossing

column2: 4. __________________ are not required to stop before crossing any railroad grade crossing.
column6: Taxis

column2: 5. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Danger ahead.

column2: 6. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column2: 7. If you are involved in a crash and must move an injured person, you should:
column6: pull the victim feet first away from the danger.
column8: keep the back and neck as straight as possible.

column2: 8. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column6: Allow others to merge smoothly.
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 9. Emergency crossovers on the interstate are legal in Tennessee for:
column4: making a U-Turn when you missed your exit.
column6: turning around when no other vehicles are present.
column8: emergency vehicles and highway maintenance crews only.

column2: 10. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: Before the stop line.

column2: 11. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column6: waiting several hours.

column2: 12. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 14. The yield sign means:
column6: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column8: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 15. When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, drivers should:
column6: turn into second lane.

column2: 16. Driver distractions include:
column6: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column8: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

column2: 17. Parking is not allowed:
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 18. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 19. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 20. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column8: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 21. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column6: only when slowing down.
column8: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 22. The road is the most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for trucks entering from the side
column6: Steep hill

column2: 24. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To halt the traffic flow.
column8: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 25. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: speedgating.

column2: 26. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 27. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 28. This warning sign:
column4: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column2: 29. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 30. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column6: stop
